As someone new to the Soulsborne genre, Elden Ring was both intimidating and exciting. The open world captivated me with its beauty and mystery, while the challenging combat taught me patience and strategy.

Exploration felt rewarding, with every discovery adding to the depth of the experience. Despite not understanding all the lore, the atmosphere and enigmatic storytelling kept me hooked.

For a first-timer, Elden Ring struck the perfect balance of challenge and accessibility. Itâ€™s not just a gameâ€”itâ€™s an unforgettable journey into a breathtaking world.

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------English Version - For those who want to read in English

Iâ€™m writing this review after completing the game for the third time. Elden Ring is FromSoftwareâ€™s most ambitious and richest game to date. I experienced the game differently each time and discovered brand-new details with every playthrough. If you want to roam freely in an open world, chasing legendary weapons while following an epic story, Elden Ring will satisfy you.

Letâ€™s talk a bit about the core idea of the game: reaching the title of "Elden Lord" in a fractured world called "Lands Between." With the destruction of the sacred Elden Ring, the world has fallen into chaos, and itâ€™s up to you, a Tarnished, to restore order. The story isnâ€™t told explicitly; you must piece it together by talking to NPCs, examining environmental details, and reading item descriptions. This enhances the gameâ€™s sense of discovery.

Your mission in the Lands Between is to collect the Great Runes, guarded by demigods, and ultimately reach the Elden Throne to either save the world or carve your own path. The game offers complete freedom: you can challenge enemies head-on or follow mysterious characters' quests to learn their stories. But enough about thatâ€”letâ€™s talk about some legendary weapons in the game.

Rivers of Blood: This legendary katana is a great choice for Arcane-focused players. Its special skill, "Corpse Piler," deals massive damage and applies a bleeding effect with each hit. You can obtain this weapon by defeating the invader "Bloody Finger Okina" in the Mountaintops of the Giants area.

Moonlight Greatsword: Fans of the Souls series will recognize this magical sword. Itâ€™s rewarded upon completing Ranniâ€™s questline. As a powerful magic sword, itâ€™s an essential choice for Intelligence-based players.

Blasphemous Blade: Obtained after defeating Rykard, this sword stands out for both its story and design. Ideal for Faith and Strength builds, its special ability unleashes a massive wave of fire that deals area damage.

Eclipse Shotel: This curved sword is unique due to its "Death Flare" ability, which applies the rare "Death" effect to enemies. You can find it in a chest at Castle Sol.

The most impressive aspect of Elden Ring is the freedom it offers players. Whether you choose to fight or run, follow the story, or simply explore the worldâ€”itâ€™s all up to you. The constant challenges and rewards turn the game into a deeply personal adventure. If youâ€™re looking for open-world freedom, tough battles, and a deep story, Elden Ring is a true masterpiece. ğŸŒŸ

Oh, and people around us may think we have no life when we play this game, but thatâ€™s not true at all. For example, do I look like a lifeless person? I donâ€™t think so. Anyway, letâ€™s wrap this up. Take care and enjoy your Elden Ring days!

16 Saatin 10 saatini sadece haritanin belli bir bolumunu kesfetmek icin harcadim ve bunu yaparken hic sikilmadim.. Zorluk derecesini Souls-Like turune yeni baslayan biri olarak gayet ortalama buldum, bosslarin patternleri asiri komplike degil ve ogrenmesi de keyifli. Tek sorun asiri delayli attacklari var. The game is beautiful. The setting, gameplay and mechanics are great. But my friend and I were dying to play co-op, so we bought it for $39. Online is a disappointment. Summoning your friend to your world is hard, playing together is even harder. When one of you dies, your friend is kicked out of your world. People who come to your world can't interact with NPCs, you and the people who come to your world can't ride horses, and you can't do many interactions. So you have to ask the producers why you need such interesting modes when you can play this game co-op with your friends on a server. Really, the online side sucks.
